content:
Get-AzureADDirectorySetting

Gets a directory setting.

Syntax

Get-AzureADDirectorySetting [-All <Boolean>] -ObjectId <String> [<CommonParameters>]
Get-AzureADDirectorySetting [-All <Boolean>] [-Top <Int32>] [<CommonParameters>]

Description

The Get-AzureADDirectorySetting cmdlet gets a directory setting from Azure Active Directory (AD).

Parameters

-All

If true, return all directory settings. If false, return the number of objects specified by the Top parameter

Type:Boolean
Required:False
Position:Named
Default value:None
Accept pipeline input:True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
Accept wildcard characters:False
-ObjectId

Specifies the ID of a directory in Azure AD.

Type:String
Required:True
Position:Named
Default value:None
Accept pipeline input:True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
Accept wildcard characters:False
-Top

Specifies the maximum number of records to return.

Type:Int32
Required:False
Position:Named
Default value:None
Accept pipeline input:True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
Accept wildcard characters:False

Related Links

  • New-AzureADDirectorySetting
  • Remove-AzureADDirectorySetting
  • Set-AzureADDirectorySetting
